text: General elections were held in Sweden on 17 September 1944.Nohlen, D & Stöver, P (2010) Elections in Europe: A data handbook, p1858 The Swedish Social Democratic Party remained the largest party, winning 115 of the 230 seats in the Second Chamber of the Riksdag.Nohlen & Stöver, p1872 Due to World War II, the four main parties continued to form a wartime coalition, only excluding the Communist Party. ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right |- |colspan=7|300px |- !Party !Votes !% !Seats !+/– |- |align=left|Social Democratic Party||1,436,571||46.6||115||–19 |- |align=left|National Organization of the Right||488,921||15.8||39||–3 |- |align=left|Farmers' League||421,094||13.6||35||+7 |- |align=left|People's Party||398,293||12.9||26||+3 |- |align=left|Communist Party||318,466||10.3||15||+12 |- |align=left|Socialist Party of Sweden||5,279||0.2||0||0 |- |align=left|Swedish Socialist Unity||4,204||0.1||0||New |- |align=left|National League of Sweden||3,819||0.1||0||New |- |align=left|Other parties||9,657||0.3||0||0 |- |align=left|Invalid/blank votes||12,799||–||–||– |- |align=left|Total||3,099,103||100||230||0 |- |align=left|Registered voters/turnout||4,310,241||71.9||–||– |- |align=left colspan=5|Source: Nohlen & Stöver |} ==References== 1944 Category:1944 elections in Europe Category:1944 in Sweden Category:September 1944 events
title: 1944 Swedish general election
